name: Bhowneesh Mendiratta
biography: Bhowneesh Mendiratta is an Indian sport shooter specializing in trap shooting. He secured India's first quota for the Paris 2024 Olympics by finishing fourth in the men's trap competition at the 2022 ISSF World Championship in Osijek, Croatia. Mendiratta started his shooting career with double trap before switching to trap shooting after double trap was removed from the Olympic events.
childhood: Bhowneesh Mendiratta was born on June 30, 1999, in Faridabad, India. He completed his schooling at Delhi Public School, Faridabad, in 2017 and later graduated from Delhi University.
professional_career: Bhowneesh Mendiratta is a prominent Indian trap shooter. He has competed in various ISSF Shotgun World Cup events and was part of the Indian team that won a silver medal in the trap team competition at the 2022 ISSF World Cup. He is recognized for his impressive performance at the 2022 World Shotgun Championships, which earned him a quota berth for the Paris 2024 Olympics.
